name: Methodology Section
description: Structured research methodology block describing data collection approach, sample characteristics, analysis methods, and study limitations. Uses a combination of prose, inline stats, and optional methodology diagram to establish research credibility.

grid.columns: 2-15 (13 columns, centered) for body text, full-width 1-16 for methodology diagrams

components: Section heading: $heading-04 in $text-01, typically 'Methodology' or 'Research Approach'
Prose description: $body-long-01 in $text-01, explaining data collection and analysis
Inline stat callouts: $heading-03 bold in $blue-60 for key numbers (sample size, time period, etc.)
Methodology diagram: optional flow chart or process illustration (see timeline-process pattern)
Limitation disclaimers: $body-short-01 in $text-03, italic, listing study constraints
Optional bordered sidebar: g10 background with $body-short-01 summarizing key methodology facts
rules: Methodology section should appear early in the document (after executive summary) or in the appendix — never buried mid-report
Lead with the approach summary in 1-2 paragraphs of $body-long-01, then break into sub-sections
Key methodology numbers (sample size, response rate, time period) use $heading-03 bold in $blue-60 inline
Limitations are mandatory for credible research — use $body-short-01 in $text-03 italic to de-emphasize
If including a methodology diagram, use the timeline-process pattern rules for visual consistency
Keep methodology concise in main body (1-2 pages max) — extended details belong in appendix
Optional fact sidebar on g10 background summarizes: n=, time period, geography, confidence interval

printBehavior.pagePosition: early in document (after exec summary) or in appendix
printBehavior.bleedHandling: no bleed — standard inset layout; g10 sidebar stays within columns

accessibilityNotes: Use <section aria-label='Methodology'> wrapper for screen reader navigation
Inline stat callouts ($heading-03 in $blue-60) need aria-label with full context (e.g., 'Sample size: 1,200 respondents')

Limitation disclaimers should be in a clearly labeled sub-section, not just italicized text — use

Limitations
Methodology fact sidebar should use <aside> with aria-label for semantic association
antiPatterns: Never omit limitations — research without stated limitations appears naive or dishonest
Never bury methodology in the middle of findings — it should be a clearly demarcated section
Never use vague descriptions like 'we analyzed data' — specify the method (regression, survey, interviews, etc.)
Never present methodology numbers in body text size — key figures (sample size, response rate) need $heading-03 emphasis
Never exceed 2 pages for main-body methodology — move extended details to Appendix (see appendix-page pattern)
